definition: to be orphaned of one's father
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
sentences.chinese: 于是大卫差遣使者为他丧父安慰他。

sentences.english: When he was eleven, his father died.
Losing her father and son was such a grave hurt that she was deeply stricken.
sentences.chinese: 丧父失子对她的打击沉重，真是创巨痛深。

sentences.english: And David's servants came to the land of the Ammonites to Hanun to console him.
sentences.chinese: 于是大卫差遣使者为他丧父安慰他。

sentences.english: Year-old death of his father, to follow the kind of grandmother came to the grandfather's home.
sentences.chinese: 四岁丧父，跟随慈祥的外祖母来到了外祖父的家中。

sentences.english: So David sent a delegation to express his sympathy to Hanun concerning his father.
sentences.chinese: 于是大卫差遣使者为他丧父安慰他。

sentences.english: Words of course cannot heal a wound of this sort.
sentences.chinese: 安慰的话语当然无法治愈丧父的痛苦。

sentences.english: I called Mandy and tried to comfort her after her father's death.
sentences.chinese: 我打电话给曼蒂想要安慰她丧父后的心情。

sentences.english: And David sent to comfort him by the hand of his servants for his father.
sentences.chinese: 于是大卫差遣臣仆，为他丧父安慰他。

definition: to be orphaned of one's father
to have lost both one's parents
to come down in the world (idiom)/to suffer a reversal of fortune
to lose sb one relies upon/to lose one's mother
